about_the_game:
■New Situational Play Experience where your talk is scored

Players are put into specific situations and what they say is scored to test their verbal skills.

Players must become a shopping navigator on a mail-order show and introduce the tools of the future, or sometimes fight off a bank robber using only the power of their words.

In the “weathercaster” challenge, players must look at a weather map and improvise a commentary like a weathercaster to get through the situation.

The player's comments are evaluated by the AI with a score for each subject.

Translated with (free version)

■ Excellent compatibility with live game play and distribution

Because players play roles in specific situations through gameplay, it allows game players and game distributors to show their personalities and unexpected sides, as well as their ability to respond at the last minute (or their mischievous side that they cannot handle) to the viewers. Another feature of the game is that it is easy to expand the talk through games, such as what you would do if you were in such a situation in real life.

Translated with (free version)

■Multiplayer support for up to 4 players

Up to 4 players can play together on a single computer. You can also play with up to 4 friends online.

In addition to the Tournament mode, in which players compete to talk about the same theme, the game also features a Stage Clear mode in which players can cooperate to clear multiple difficulty levels,

In addition, there is a stage-clear mode where players can clear multiple difficulty levels by cooperating with each other.

In Tournament Mode, not only the AI but also players who are not participating in the game can score the game.

Enjoy a different experience in each mode and scoring setting of your choice.

Stage Clear Mode can also be enjoyed in single-player mode.

■Don't worry if you can't come up with an answer. A hint function is also implemented.

In Stage Clear Mode and Tournament Mode, keywords are displayed to give you a hint in case you can't come up with an answer. Sometimes, there may be a word that you may want to poke your head into.

■Video Distribution Guidelines

We welcome video distribution and live broadcasting. Monetization is not a problem. There are no restrictions on the scope of distribution. Both individual and corporate video distribution is acceptable. When distributing, please include the URL of the Steam Store page for this title in the summary section. (If you cannot post the URL due to the terms and conditions of the video distribution platform, we would appreciate it if you could mention where it is available for purchase in the video. However, the following acts are prohibited. Videos that violate the laws and regulations of each country - Videos that infringe on the intellectual property rights of the work or others - Slanderous videos - Videos shot with illegally obtained game data *This guideline may be added or changed without prior notice. Please understand that these guidelines are subject to additions and changes without notice.

■Precautions and Restrictions on Play

This game uses the functions of ChatGPT, an interactive artificial intelligence provided by OpenAI, and Gemini, an interactive artificial intelligence provided by Google, Inc. If there is any change in the functions or services of “ChatGPT” provided by OpenAI or “Gemini” provided by Google, the service of this game may be suspended or terminated without notice. Please understand this in advance. This game uses Microsoft's “Azure” function to transcribe the microphone input, and may not be able to be played depending on the Azure server status. The service of this game may be suspended or terminated without prior notice in the event of any changes in the functions or services of Azure provided by Microsoft Corporation. Please understand this in advance.

short_description: A game that tests your ad-lib verbal skills using a microphone. You can test your word power with various subjects, such as handling a bank robbery with just the power of words, or becoming a weathercaster and ad-libbing your way through a weather forecast.
